abstract: Google acquires a start-up called Aardvark, which was founded by a group of former Google employees.
snippet: Google acquires a start-up called Aardvark, which was founded by a group of former Google employees.
lead_paragraph: Google has agreed to acquire Aardvark, a San Francisco-based start-up that taps a user’s social network to find someone who can answer their questions, according to representatives of the companies.

headline.main: Google Agrees to Buy ‘Social Search’ Service

abstract: Google has agreed to acquire Aardvark, a San Francisco-based start-up that taps a user’s social network to find someone who can answer their questions, according to representatives of the companies.
snippet: Google has agreed to acquire Aardvark, a San Francisco-based start-up that taps a user’s social network to find someone who can answer their questions, according to representatives of the companies.

headline.main: Google Agrees to Buy Social Search Service

abstract: Sergey Brin, co-founder of Google, also urged other companies recently hit by Chinese hackers to speak out.
snippet: Sergey Brin, co-founder of Google, also urged other companies recently hit by Chinese hackers to speak out.
lead_paragraph: Sergey Brin, a Google co-founder, speaking publicly for the first time about the hacking attacks on Google in late 2009, said Friday that the company still hoped to find a way to continue operating its Google.cn search service in China, which it has blamed for the attacks.

headline.main: Google Co-Founder Hopeful About Uncensored Search in China
